programme.title: Live ATP Masters Tennis
programme.desc: The Monte-Carlo Masters. Coverage of the third day's play of the clay court tournament at the Monte-Carlo Country Club in Monaco, featuring matches from the first and second rounds. The second round of last year's tournament saw all 15 of the remaining seeded players progress to the third round, with eventual champion Novak Djokovic overcoming qualifier Albert Ramos-Vinolas 6-1, 6-4, before going on to defeat Marin Cilic in straight sets. However, while Roger Federer would make light work of Jeremy Chardy in round two he came unstuck against in Gael Monfils in the third round, losing 6-4, 7-6.(n)

programme.title: Live ATP Masters Tennis
programme.desc: The Monte-Carlo Masters. Coverage of the fourth day's play at the Monte-Carlo Country Club in Monaco, featuring matches from the second and third rounds. Rafael Nadal dominated this tournament between 2005 and 2012 when he won this competition a record eight times in a row, and the Spaniard will hope to put injury and fitness woes behind him as he returns to play on his favourite surface. More recently, Novak Djokovic has triumphed here at two of the last three stagings, while Stan Wawrinka also prevailed in 2014.(n)

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Lee McKenzie introduces coverage of the Japanese Grand Prix from the Suzuka circuit. McLaren's Lewis Hamilton is a previous winner, although his victory came at the Fuji Speedway circuit in 2007. Last year he managed a third-place finish here, but it was Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel who took the honours ahead of Jarno Trulli. With Ferrari's Fernando Alonso another previous winner at this famously-demanding circuit, expect the competition to be fierce as the season nears its climax(n)
